common_issues.title: Pieces OS Connectivity Issues in Remote Environments
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties connecting to Pieces OS and its features, particularly Copilot, from remote environments like WSL2 and Docker containers. This is often due to network configuration issues, including loopback interfaces and port access. Solutions involve adjusting network settings, ensuring proper Pieces OS installation, and utilizing the latest version of the Pieces VS Code extension.

related_issues.title: VSCode extension issue rendering Copilot when installed via snap in WSL2
related_issues.text:
VSCode extension issue rendering Copilot when installed via snap in WSL2
### Software

VS Code

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When Pieces OS is installed via snap in WSL2 for windows and VSCode is also installed through snap in WSL2, there is an issue detecting Pieces OS location and setting the proper API url.


Setting a custom url to the linux port 'http://localhost:5323' and following the WSL steps listed here: https://docs.pieces.app/product-highlights-and-benefits/connecting-to-a-remote-pieces-os-instance allows for communication between the VSCode extension and Pieces OS itself.

However, when VSCode attempts to request the Pieces Copilot -- The applet is launched on a port, the port is returned to the extension, but the Copilot fails to render in VSCode.

Until the root cause is detected and resolved, the recommended workaround is to install Pieces OS via Pieces Suite and run VSCode outside of WSL2 if at all possible.
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points:**

* The issue involves network connectivity problems within WSL2 when accessing Pieces OS and Copilot.
* The healthcheck API successfully returns "ok", but Copilot fails to render.
* Systemd was already enabled, and the networking mode is "mirrored".

**Problems Identified:**

* Potential network issues within WSL2.
* Unsuccessful Copilot rendering despite successful healthcheck.
* Unsure if the issue is WSL2 or snap installation related.

**Proposed/Implemented Solutions:**

* Enabling the dns-tunnel option within WSL2.
* Investigating further to determine the root cause (WSL2 or snap installation).

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue remains unresolved.
* Further investigation is required to diagnose the cause and implement a solution.

related_issues.text: Seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment (VS Code running remote docker container) ### Software VS Code ### Operating System / Platform macOS ### Your Pieces OS Version 11.02 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. I'm having the same problem as this: https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/269 Using VS Code project within a docker container and getting this message: > Woops! It seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment & Pieces for VS Code cannot connect to Pieces OS. Please refer to our documentation on how to resolve this issue. ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ffeb53fd-0787-4bc2-9faf-c5f3d179294b) Pieces OS version: ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/640d35af-6106-4717-9269-c51205ff23fb) I followed this guide but with no luck: https://docs.pieces.app/product-highlights-and-benefits/connecting-to-a-remote-pieces-os-instance LAN IP: VS Code settings, pieces custom URL: ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/aaed7eb8-36e7-49cb-b6e0-84271adb8027) What else can I try? Thanks! ## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation **Key Points Raised:** * User @malanciault reported an error when trying to connect to Pieces OS from a remote Docker instance in VS Code. * The default listening interface for Pieces Server changed to loopback in version 11.0.0, causing this issue. **Problems Identified:** * Pieces Server only listens to loopback, preventing connections from the remote Docker instance. * Host.docker.internal resolution is incompatible with the Webview tool windows in Pieces. **Solutions Proposed/Implemented:** * A patch to the VSCode plugin was created to allow automatic detection of Pieces OS and remove the need for a custom URL. * A workaround involving creating a DNS entry was suggested, but ultimately not implemented. **Current Status/Outcome:** * Patch released in version 2.0.2 of the Pieces for VSCode extension. * Issue should be resolved for most users. * User @malanciault may need to update the extension and try again, or contact Pieces support for further assistance.

related_issues.title: Pieces plugin for UltraEdit is unresponsive after asking copilot to describe ~3000 line .py script
related_issues.text:
Pieces plugin for UltraEdit is unresponsive after asking copilot to describe ~3000 line .py script
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

In UltraEdit I opened the python script available at https://github.com/eldraco/domain_analyzer/blob/master/domain_analyzer.py. I opened the Pieces plugin and using default settings prompted it to describe the script: "What does this Python script do?" The UE plugin never returns any content and seems to be unresponsive. 

In Pieces Desktop, I do see the result, however interaction with it is latent indicating some sort of continual background processing even though the LLM has completed processing. Additionally, there seem to be significant scroll issues, and the code view doesn't appear to be calculating line numbers correctly, showing many empty lines after line 1,918, when line 2,837 is the last line in the file.

Finally, the Pieces Desktop code view shows a wrap in the line number margin.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9be69032-f2e2-4379-843c-cd0bf14da63a)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* @bschwenk reported two issues:
    * Context issues with specific file in Pieces 1.5 flash and gpt4o
    * Line numbers wrapping in the editor 
* @mark-at-pieces confirmed and investigated the context issue.
* @sam-at-pieces identified and tested a fix for the context issue.

**Problems identified:**

* Context issue: The file provided by @bschwenk was not being included in the context, causing incorrect responses. 
* Line numbers wrapping: The line numbers in the editor were wrapping unexpectedly.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* A fix for the context issue was identified by @sam-at-pieces and included in the upcoming release (11.0.4).
* Investigation of the line numbers wrapping issue was assigned to @mack-at-pieces.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The context issue has been resolved and will be released in Pieces 11.0.4.
* The line numbers wrapping issue is still under investigation.

related_issues.text:
Copilot Bug: 'I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please...' copilot response
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

hi i have been using it for 2 days but for the last 2 hours the desktop and visual studio extension are not working. 

No matter what I type, it gives me this error. There was an update message for the app, it was about installing a version, I installed it but it didn't fix it.
always the same message 
visual studio ide 2022 17.12 
windows 10 pro
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c64d85bd-eb1a-4f1c-a25e-570c9a55ccd1)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/55b600a6-95f4-4e71-aee1-1b1ce8b6599c)


## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* Users reported encountering the same error message: "me too".
* Outdated OpenAI API keys were identified as a potential cause of the issue.
* Switching to the GPT4o model was suggested as a solution.
* Updating to version 11.0.3 and signing in to Pieces were recommended.

**Problems Identified:**

* Claudes and Geminis were experiencing issues, leading to the "me too" error.
* Outdated OpenAI API keys could lead to invalid access and errors.
* OpenAI models might be experiencing failures.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Remove OpenAI API key.
* Switch to GPT4o model.
* Update to version 11.0.3 and sign in to Pieces.
* Remove OpenAI API key and keep it out of the product for now.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The "me too" error seems to be resolved for some users after removing their OpenAI API keys.
* OpenAI models are still under investigation for potential failures.
* The recommended solution is to switch to the GPT4o model or temporarily keep the OpenAI API key out of the product.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue seems to be ongoing, with further investigation needed.
* The proposed solutions might not work for all users.
